questions.question: Tell me about a project you managed from start to finish.
questions.canonical_answer: I defined scope, created the plan, coordinated the team, tracked progress, managed risks, and delivered the project on time with measurable results.

questions.question: How do you handle scope creep?
questions.canonical_answer: I document changes, evaluate impact, communicate with stakeholders, and update timelines or reject requests depending on priorities.

questions.question: What project management methodologies have you used?
questions.canonical_answer: Iâ€™ve used Agile, Scrum, Kanban, and Waterfall depending on project needs, team structure, and delivery timelines.

questions.question: How do you prioritize tasks when managing multiple projects?
questions.canonical_answer: I prioritize based on urgency, business impact, dependencies, and resource availability while using tools to track progress clearly.

questions.question: How do you deal with team conflicts?
questions.canonical_answer: I listen to each side, identify the root cause, mediate openly, and guide the team toward a fair, solution-focused resolution.

questions.question: How do you measure project success?
questions.canonical_answer: I measure success using timely delivery, meeting scope and quality goals, staying within budget, and achieving stakeholder satisfaction.

questions.question: How do you manage risks in a project?
questions.canonical_answer: I identify risks early, assess their impact, create mitigation plans, monitor changes, and communicate proactively with stakeholders.
